paper_abstract: Let G be a directed planar graph of complexity n, each arc having a nonnegative length. Let s and t be two distinct faces of G; let s(1) ,..., s(k) be vertices incident with s; let t(1) ,..., t(k) be vertices incident with t. We give an algorithm to compute k pairwise vertex-disjoint paths connecting the pairs (s(i), t(i)) in G, with minimal total length, in O(kn log n) time.
paper_title: Shortest Vertex-Disjoint Two-Face Paths in Planar Graphs
